lead_paragraph: An article on Thursday about Western Kentucky University’s history in basketball and the breaking of racial barriers misstated the name of the university whose five African-American starters won the 1966 N.C.A.A. men’s tournament by defeating Kentucky’s five white starters. It was Texas Western — not the University of Texas in El Paso, which has been Texas Western’s name since 1967.
